title: Technology Causes More Controversy In The Ashes | 10 News
description: More snicko drama on a sweltering day, two of the Christmas Test, with both nations left bewildered by the under-fire technology. Nathan Lyon made history as Australia made light work of the English batters, in a commanding position to win the Ashes in Adelaide. title: Hero's Message: The International Student Who Helped Bondi Victims
description: In the wake of the terror of the Bondi shooting, we have also seen the best of humanity. Pasha Rahemath was among the strangers who put their lives on the line to help those in danger. The Uber driver from India was picking up a passenger when the attack started. He ran to help carry victims onto surf rescue boards and stretchers and then into ambulances. The father of two told 10 News+ that a man died in his arms and that he helped console multiple injured people. title: Puppy Training Tips For Those Planning To Add To Their Family This Christmas | 10 News+
description: Christmas is next week, and it's a time when many families think about getting a puppy as a gift. Animal welfare organisations generally discourage buying pets as presents and encourage adoption instead. Regardless, training is vital, and to provide tips and tricks, 10 News+ is joined by Amy Smith, founder of Amy’s Puppy Pre-School, along with Yogi, a 12-week-old puppy in training. title: Aussie Researchers Investigate Links Between Microplastics & Cardiovascular Disease | 10 News+
description: Aussie researchers are leading a world-first study to find out what damage microplastics could be doing to our hearts. The federal government will provide $1.2 million to the Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute to investigate whether plastics contribute to cardiovascular disease. title: Hero Ahmed Al-Ahmed Awarded $2.5M Check | 10 News
description: Bondi hero Ahmed al-Ahmed has been handed a cheque for more than $2.5 million, raised by more than 43,000 donors after the deadly shooting.  The cheque was presented by US influencer Zachery Dereniowski on behalf of GoFundMe, with the campaign including a $99,999 donation from American billionaire Bill Ackman.  Mr Al Ahmed disarmed gunman Sajid Akram during the attack and was shot twice while trying to protect others.  Total donations across verified fundraisers for victims and families of the Bondi attack have now reached almost $5 million. title: Former NASCAR Star Greg Biffle Killed In North Carolina Plane Crash | 10 News
description: Former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and several members of his family have died in a plane crash in North Carolina, according to local police.  The 55-year-old was among seven people killed when a business jet crashed while attempting to land at Statesville Regional Airport, north of Charlotte.  Flight records show the aircraft was registered to a company run by Biffle, with police saying it is believed he and immediate family were on board.  The National Transportation Safety Board and the FAA are investigating the crash.
